channel.title: Quantified self on Joost Plattel
channel.description: Recent content in Quantified self on Joost Plattel

item.title: A lecture in Ghent
item.description:
A few weeks agoÂ I gave a lecture in Ghent, a beautiful city and so I decided to spend the weekend at an AirBnB host to enjoy the city! Here's a picture I took: I've uploaded all the slides from the lecture on Slideshare for you to enjoy.
It was my longest lecture and I've learned some useful things while doing so. I find that having a storyline with little pieces is harder to keep up over longer times, so next time I will try to venture more in depth of some of my personal tracking experiments, for example my phone usage.

item.title: Quantified Phone Usage with iPython
item.description: Technology is making it easier to collect data, for example phone usage. From the 1st of January I tracked how much I've used my phone by installing an app called Moment. It runs in the background and silently tracks how much you use your phone. As said, the first step towards behaviour-change is providing insight in current behaviour. Lately I've been exploring iPython for data-analysis and sharing snippets of data. I've started a Github repository that contains some notebooks I'm working on.
